thiru_sundaram wrote:
>
> Hi
> I am invoking heritrix through my application . I have placed
> heritrix.jar in my classpath.
> I want to write a new processor but i do not want to modifiy the
> processor.options file in the heritrix.jar.
>
> Does heritrix provide a way to override its options file with our own?
>







I wonder what would happen if you added your own modules file and had it 
appear later on the CLASSPATH (For example, make a jar that has your new 
module in it and include in it a file at 'modules/processor.options', 
etc.)?  It looks like we try to do the right thing and read all found on 
the CLASSPATH and it looks like the last module read will prevail. See 
http://crawler.archive.org/xref/org/archive/crawler/admin/CrawlJobHandler.html#1165.

Let us know if it works or not.

St.Ack

 


>
>
